verses.verse: ( The Fool Says There Is No God) ( 230 14:1-7 ;  290 59:1-17 ;  520 3:9-20 ) לַמְנַצֵּ֥חַ <WH5329> lam·naṣ·ṣê·aḥ For the choirmaster. עַֽל־ <WH5921> ‘al- According to מָחֲלַ֗ת <WH4257> mā·ḥă·laṯ Mahalath. ( Mahalath is probably a musical or liturgical term; see also .) מַשְׂכִּ֥יל <WH4905> maś·kîl A Maskil ( Maskil is probably a musical or liturgical term; used for , , , , , , , and 142.) לְדָוִֽד׃ <WH1732> lə·ḏā·wiḏ of David. אָ֘מַ֤ר <WH559> ’ā·mar says נָבָ֣ל <WH5036> nā·ḇāl The fool בְּ֭לִבּוֹ <WH3820> bə·lib·bōw in his heart, אֵ֣ין <WH369> ’ên “ [There is] no אֱלֹהִ֑ים <WH430> ’ĕ·lō·hîm God. ” הִֽ֝שְׁחִ֗יתוּ <WH7843> hiš·ḥî·ṯū They are corrupt; וְהִֽתְעִ֥יבוּ <WH8581> wə·hiṯ·‘î·ḇū their ways עָ֝֗וֶל <WH5766> ‘ā·wel are vile. אֵ֣ין <WH369> ’ên There is no עֹֽשֵׂה־ <WH6213> ‘ō·śêh- one who does טֽוֹב׃ <WH2896> ṭō·wḇ good.

אֱ‍ֽלֹהִ֗ים <WH430> ’ĕlō·hîm God מִשָּׁמַיִם֮ <WH8064> miš·šā·ma·yim from heaven הִשְׁקִ֪יף <WH8259> hiš·qîp̄ looks down עַֽל־ <WH5921> ‘al- upon בְּנֵ֫י <WH1121> bə·nê the sons אָדָ֥ם <WH120> ’ā·ḏām of men לִ֭רְאוֹת <WH7200> lir·’ō·wṯ to see הֲיֵ֣שׁ <WH3426> hă·yêš if any מַשְׂכִּ֑יל <WH7919> maś·kîl understand, דֹּ֝רֵ֗שׁ <WH1875> dō·rêš if any seek אֶת־ <WH853> ’eṯ- - אֱלֹהִֽים׃ <WH430> ’ĕ·lō·hîm God.

כֻּלּ֥וֹ <WH3605> kul·lōw All סָג֮ <WH5472> sāḡ have turned away, יַחְדָּ֪ו <WH3162> yaḥ·dāw they have together נֶ֫אֱלָ֥חוּ <WH444> ne·’ĕ·lā·ḥū become corrupt; ( LXX worthless) אֵ֤ין <WH369> ’ên there is no עֹֽשֵׂה־ <WH6213> ‘ō·śêh- one who does ט֑וֹב <WH2896> ṭō·wḇ good, אֵ֝֗ין <WH369> ’ên not גַּם־ <WH1571> gam- even אֶחָֽד׃ <WH259> ’e·ḥāḏ one. הֲלֹ֥א <WH3808> hă·lō never יָדְעוּ֮ <WH3045> yā·ḏə·‘ū learn? פֹּ֤עֲלֵ֫י <WH6466> pō·‘ă·lê Will the workers אָ֥וֶן <WH205> ’ā·wen of iniquity אֹכְלֵ֣י <WH398> ’ō·ḵə·lê They devour עַ֭מִּי <WH5971> ‘am·mî my people אָ֣כְלוּ <WH398> ’ā·ḵə·lū [like] לֶ֑חֶם <WH3899> le·ḥem bread; אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים <WH430> ’ĕ·lō·hîm upon God. לֹ֣א <WH3808> lō they refuse קָרָֽאוּ׃ <WH7121> qā·rā·’ū to call

שָׁ֤ם׀ <WH8033> šām There they are, פָּֽחֲדוּ־ <WH6342> pā·ḥă·ḏū- overwhelmed פַחַד֮ <WH6343> p̄a·ḥaḏ with dread, לֹא־ <WH3808> lō- nothing הָ֪יָה֫ <WH1961> hā·yāh [where] there was פָ֥חַד <WH6343> p̄ā·ḥaḏ to fear. כִּֽי־ <WH3588> kî- For אֱלֹהִ֗ים <WH430> ’ĕ·lō·hîm God פִּ֭זַּר <WH6340> piz·zar has scattered עַצְמ֣וֹת <WH6106> ‘aṣ·mō·wṯ the bones חֹנָ֑ךְ <WH2583> ḥō·nāḵ of those who besieged you. הֱ֝בִשֹׁ֗תָה <WH954> hĕ·ḇi·šō·ṯāh You put them to shame, כִּֽי־ <WH3588> kî- for אֱלֹהִ֥ים <WH430> ’ĕ·lō·hîm God מְאָסָֽם׃ <WH3988> mə·’ā·sām has despised them.
